text:
CFOs play a critical role in a
digital transformation,

as you are responsible
for ensuring that the transformation
is financially viable.

You manage the investments
effectively and make sure value
is realized across the business.

CFOs have some key responsibilities
during a transformation.

One responsibility
is partnering with the CIO to

develop and implement a cloud
strategy that aligns with the

organization’s business
strategy.

The CFO role is critical
to both planning and driving

the strategy as it has to be integrated
into both the short-term and the long-term
financial plans.

The CFO and CIO need to iterate
on these plans to show up as a

unified force with the rest of
the C-suite.

Another responsibility
of the CFO is to assess the impact

on the organization’s
financial performance.

Payback period, returns,
and what the investment

profile looks like will influence
the pace of migration and modernization.

The CFO’s deep expertise
on the financials will help
influence the strategy.

The CFO should also lead in the
development of the business
case for digital transformation.

The CFO can partner with IT and
product to lay out the investments

and expected value and highlight
the most critical assumptions
for leadership.

The CFO is also responsible
for identifying and managing

financial risks throughout
the process to make any necessary
trade-offs.

And finally, the CFO should
negotiate and agree to contractual

terms with cloud providers
in partnership with procurement.

Roles and responsibilities
vary by organization,

but CFOs need to have a voice
in the development of agreements

with such a critical part of the
business.
